intro: Sida miqueliana, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Sida miqueliana is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
